msContents.summary: Eukles writes to Zenon asking that he give to Moschion 20 jars of ordinary wine; he adds a statement about money owed by some of Zenon's tenants who were requesting an extension

msItemStruct.note: 12 lines written along the fibers; on the back, across the fibers, address and docket

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 26 (original no. 48) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Eukles to Zenon greeting. You will do me a favor by giving the 20 jars of ordinary wine, about which I have often reminded you, to my servant, Moschion. As soon as I meet you I will pay you the price. Regarding the money about which you commissioned me, those who have the most days(in which to pay) ask me to give them an extension of ten days while they are mowing. As soon as they furnish it, I will make an advance payment to you if you have need of it. Good-bye. Year 6, Thoth 15. [Verso:] [Docket:] Eukles regarding 20 jars of ordinary wine. Year 6. [Address:] To Zenon.
